map_node.indicator_name: Housing Maintenance: Homes with 3 or more maintenance deficiencies

dataset.how_calculated: Estimated number of households in an area reporting three or more maintenance deficiencies (heating equipment breakdown, additional heating required, rodent infestation, cracks/holes in the walls, ceilings or floors, broken plaster/peeling paint larger than 8½ x 11 inches, toilet breakdowns, or water leaks from outside the unit), divided by the number of households in the area; expressed as percent.
dataset.discription: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

dataset.how_calculated: Estimated number of households reporting three or more maintenance deficiencies (heating equipment breakdown, additional heating required, rodent infestation, cracks/holes in the walls, ceilings or floors, broken plaster/peeling paint larger than 8½ x 11 inches, toilet breakdowns, or water leaks from outside the unit).
dataset.discription: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

unreliable_text: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.

info.info_name: Homes with Mice or Rats in the Building
info.info_how_calculated: Estimated number of households in an area that reported mice or rats in their building in the past 90 days, divided by the number of households in the area; expressed as percent.
info.info_source: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

info.info_how_calculated: Estimated number of households in an area that reported cracks or holes in the home, divided by the number of households in the area; expressed as percent.
info.info_source: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

info.info_how_calculated: Estimated number of households in an area that reported leaks coming from outside the unit, divided by the number of households in the area; expressed as percent.
info.info_source: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

info.info_name: Homes with 3 or More Maintenance Deficiencies
info.info_how_calculated: Estimated number of households in an area reporting three or more maintenance deficiencies (heating equipment breakdown, additional heating required, rodent infestation, cracks/holes in the walls, ceilings or floors, broken plaster/peeling paint larger than 8½ x 11 inches, toilet breakdowns, or water leaks from outside the unit), divided by the number of households in the area; expressed as percent.
info.info_source: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

info.info_how_calculated: Estimated number of households in an area that reported seeing at least one cockroach daily over the last month, divided by the number of households in the area; expressed as percent.
info.info_source: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

show_disparities_node.disparitiesPagetext: When population health or the quality of living environments varies by population characteristics such as income or race, there is disparity. One way to visualize disparity is to chart indicators of health or environment across levels of neighborhood poverty. We categorized neighborhoods as high, medium or low poverty. Then we took the median of the neighborhood-specific values in each category. The median is the middle of the sorted group of values.
show_disparities_node.indicator_name: Housing Maintenance: Homes with 3 or more maintenance deficiencies

Link.graph_title: Housing Maintenance: Homes with 3 or more maintenance deficiencies

info.info_name: Homes with 3 or More Maintenance Deficiencies
info.info_how_calculated: Estimated number of households in an area reporting three or more maintenance deficiencies (heating equipment breakdown, additional heating required, rodent infestation, cracks/holes in the walls, ceilings or floors, broken plaster/peeling paint larger than 8½ x 11 inches, toilet breakdowns, or water leaks from outside the unit), divided by the number of households in the area; expressed as percent.
info.info_source: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

info.info_how_calculated: Neighborhoods are ranked according to the percent of people whose annual income falls below 100% of the federal poverty level. Rankings are then divided into 3 approximately equal groupings of low, medium and high poverty.

link_data_node.linkDataPagetext: The "Link Data" function shows associations between environmental health data at the neighborhood level using <a href="http://a816-dohbesp.nyc.gov/IndicatorPublic/Glossary.aspx?#Scatterplot" target="_blank">scatterplots.</a> The points represent x and y values for each NYC neighborhood. The pairs of indicators available for scatterplots were chosen because previous research suggests that one may either directly or indirectly cause or contribute to the other. Because the data being charted are <a href="http://a816-dohbesp.nyc.gov/IndicatorPublic/Glossary.aspx?#Ecological_Study" target="_blank">ecological</a> and not individual level, and because many factors contribute to the health of a population or environment, the patterns seen in these charts do not necessarily represent the underlying causal relationship.

Compare.graph_title: Neighborhood Housing Maintenance: Disruptive Noise Exposure by Homes with 3 or more maintenance deficiencies
Compare.y_axis_title: Homes with 3 or More Maintenance Deficiencies - Percent of Households 2008

info.y_axis_title_reg: Homes with 3 or More Maintenance Deficiencies
info.info_how_calculated: Estimated number of adults who reported experiencing noise disruption three or more times per week, divided by the number of adults in the area; expressed as percent. Disruptive noise exposure is any ambient noise from outside the home that disrupts activities - such as watching television, listening to the radio, having a conversation, or sleeping - of the person who hears it.
info.info_source: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)
